One of these was Sanford "Pretty" Sperberg (born Leib Sparberg in Roumania in 1916), who sailed to Spain on the SS Georgic on May 15, 1937 and kept in touch with Trost by letter, describing his shipboard experiences, his early days in Spain in Spain (with comments on anarchist activity and other political news), and his battlefield experiences with the Lincoln-Washington Battalion. The Carl Trost Papers were donated to the Tamiment Library, NYU by Bonnie Scott in August 2011.
